step1.ptxt: The power window control system controls the power windows' UP / DOWN function using the regulator motors.

The main controls of this system are: the power window regulator master switch, which is built into the driver side door, and the power window regulator switches, which are built into the passenger side door and rear doors. Pressing a regulator switch or any of the switches on the master switch transmits an UP / DOWN signal to the corresponding power window regulator motor.

entry.ptxt: Power Window Regulator Master Switch Assembly

item.ptxt: Controls window operations for all windows
When window lock switch is set to lock position, window operation will only be possible with master switch's driver switch
Located on passenger side door and rear doors
Each regulator switch controls window operations for its respective window

entry.ptxt: Receives switch signals and changes signals into motor activation to change window position

step1.ptxt: The power window control system has the following functions.

item.ptxt: Function that raises window while power window switch is pulled up, and lowers window while pushed halfway down (window stops as soon as switch is released)
Function that raises window while power window switch is pulled up, and lowers window while pushed down (window stops as soon as switch is released)

entry.ptxt: Function that enables window of driver side door to be fully opened by one full push downward on power window switch
Function that allows power window master switch to control manual UP / DOWN operation of passenger side power window and rear power windows

item.ptxt: Function that disables passenger side power window and rear power window operations when window lock switch of master switch is pressed
Passenger side power window and rear power windows can be operated when window lock switch is pressed again
